title: Model Application - predicting a future value

content.question:
Year
Life Expectancy
(years)
2000
<math alttext="76.75"><mn>76.75</mn></math>
2004
<math alttext="77.38"><mn>77.38</mn></math>
2008
<math alttext="78.19"><mn>78.19</mn></math>
2012
<math alttext="78.79"><mn>78.79</mn></math>
2016
<math alttext="78.86"><mn>78.86</mn></math>
2019
<math alttext="78.87"><mn>78.87</mn></math>

​The table gives values of average life expectancy, in years, for a child born in a given year in the United States. A linear regression is used to construct a linear function model <math alttext="L"><mi>L</mi></math>, where <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math> represents the birth year, <math alttext="t equals 0"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> is the year 2000, and <math alttext="L open parentheses t close parentheses"><mi>L</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></math> represents the life expectancy in years. For what year does the model predict that the life expectancy of a child born in that year will be <math alttext="83"><mn>83</mn></math> years?

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Apply numerical results in a given mathematical or applied context.
